org.apache.taverna.monitor.impl

Class MonitorTreeModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.monitor.impl.MonitorTreeModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer<MonitorManager.MonitorMessage>

    public class MonitorTreeModel
extends Object
implements Observer<MonitorManager.MonitorMessage>
    A relatively naive Monitor interface which holds all state in a tree model. Use getMonitor() to get the monitor singleton, all workflows under a given JVM use the same instance in this implementation with the root node of the monitor tree corresponding to the monitor itself.

    Internally we use a default tree model with default mutable tree nodes where the user object is set to instances of MonitorNode, with the exception of the 'true' root of the tree in which it is set to the MonitorImpl itself

    Author:
    Tom Oinn, Stian Soiland-Reyes

      • setNodeRemovalDelay

        public void setNodeRemovalDelay(long delayTime)
        Nodes will be removed at least delayTime milliseconds after their initial deregistration request, this allows UI components to show nodes which would otherwise vanish almost instantaneously.
        Parameters:
        delayTime - time in milliseconds between the deregistration request and attempt to actually remove the node in question

      • deregisterNode

        protected void deregisterNode(String[] owningProcess)
        Request the removal of the specified node from the monitor tree. In this particular case the removal task will be added to a timer and executed at some (slightly) later time as determined by the removalDelay property.
